Authors: Binsar F., Eryanto E., Wahyudi I., Sugandi Y., Suroso J.S.
Title: Risk of invalidation of data in hospital information systems in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Binsar, F., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Eryanto, E., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wahyudi, I., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sugandi, Y., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suroso, J.S., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems, Management Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Patient medical record data stored in hospital management information systems have become a necessity and demand for policymakers to obtain information quickly. The existence of this medical record can provide health profile information and medical history of the patients being treated. With this basis, doctors and medical staff can provide diagnoses, suggestions for actions to be taken as well as accuracy in determining the drug for patient consumption. However, medical records in the system at the hospital have not been packaged properly invalid data conditions, because the data collection and input processes were carried out by different officers. Not only the ability of officers to interact with information system modules but also discipline, accuracy, mastery of officers in the medical field as well as the ability to read manual documents to be re-entered into the information system. This research was carried out based on direct monitoring of the system used in several hospitals and found the existence of data invalidity in the information system that has the potential to become a risk that ultimately becomes a loss both for patients and for medical staff and hospital management. Allowing invalid data will be a threat that comes from within the hospital environment itself. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Data validation; Electronic medical record; Health information system; Information system security; Risk management
Index Keywords: Diagnosis; Hospitals; Human resource management; Information management; Information use; Medical computing; Patient treatment; Data collection; Direct monitoring; Hospital environment; Hospital information systems; Hospital management; Medical fields; Medical history; Medical record; Medical information systems

Authors: Darmawan T., Birawa A.S., Eryanto E., Mauritsius T.
Title: Credit classification using crisp-dm method on bank abc customers
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Departement, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems, Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Darmawan, T., Information Systems Management Departement, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems, Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Birawa, A.S., Information Systems Management Departement, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems, Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Eryanto, E., Information Systems Management Departement, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems, Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mauritsius, T., Information Systems Management Departement, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems, Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information systems are very important in the banking industry. This is because to simplify the decision-making process, one of which is the determination of prospective credit customers at Bank ABC. Bank ABC is one of the financial institutions in the growth phase needed to improve the quality of safe, high-quality and accurate credit. The purpose of this study is to accelerate the decision making process of credit customers, namely whether credit is accepted or rejected. One method used is CRISP-DM as standart processes for data mining. Election algorithm using the C4.5 decision tree algorithm. The final result of this study is the prediction of the pattern of credit results for credit customers. This pattern is generated from decision tree is expexted to be a reference for credit customer take a credit at Bank ABC. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Algoritm; CRISP-DM; Data mining; Information systems; Pattern of credit

Title: Design of human resource security and physic security data center with ISO/IEC 27002:2005 standardization and TIA-942 standardization with PPDIOO method at DISKOMINFO pemerintah kabupaten bandung
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Abstract: Data center have an important role in organization, namely as an ICT infrastructure, and as an important asset issued by organization. Existence of data center as an important role in organization, need policies Human Resources (HR) security and physical security, to create data center that have a sense of security and quality in order to support continuity of ICT services in organization.Dinas Komunikasi Informatika dan Statistik (DISKOMINFO) Pemerintah Kabupaten Bandung, based on current condition of available data center can be classified in category of server space and not have a very significant readiness for policy implementation HR security and physical of data center. Based on current condition, it is necessary to analyze the suitability of current condition related of HR security and physical security of data center, with ISO/IEC 27002:2005 standardization, TIA-942 standardization, and relevant legal regulations, using Prepare, Plan, Design, Implement, Operate, and Optimize (PPDIOO) network life cycle Method with use of stages up to design phase. The results of research proposed are drafting policies of HR security and physical security of data center in accordance with ISO/IEC 27002:2005 standardization, TIA-942 standardization, and relevant legal regulations. IJSTR © 2020.
Author Keywords: Data Center; DISKOMINFO Pemerintah Kabupaten Bandung; HR Security; ISO/IEC 27002:2005; Physic Security; PPDIOO Method; TIA-942
